Posted By: psyklone (12/22/2009 1:30:43 PM)

posts.post_content: I believe even newest players heard or will soon hear about this cult creature - its name is often used as a measure for playability of creatures costing 3 mana in limited decks (regarding cost: power/toughness ratio - creatures of same size or bigger than 2/2 costing 3 mana are generally considered playable - though not exactly cool if they really are *really* Gray Ogres - and weaker creatures unplayable). See Grizzly Bears and Hill Giant for similar standards on creatures costing 2 and 4 mana.
posts.html:
I believe even newest players heard or will soon hear about this cult creature - its name is often used as a measure for playability of creatures costing 3 mana in limited decks (regarding cost: power/toughness ratio - creatures of same size or bigger than 2/2 costing 3 mana are generally considered playable - though not exactly cool if they really are really Gray Ogres - and weaker creatures unplayable). See Grizzly Bears and Hill Giant for similar standards on creatures costing 2 and 4 mana.

posts.post_content:
[Goblin Hero](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Hero) and [Gray Ogre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gray Ogre) are pals. They now sit at the bar where they tell stories of how they used to be relevant.   
  
[Serra Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Serra Angel) is the bartender, while [Sengir Vampire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sengir Vampire) is the owner of the fine establishment. He usually has to kick [Volcanic Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Dragon) out every now and then.
posts.html:
